intro: Solena umbellata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often arranged in clusters at the base of the stems. Solena umbellata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
